item.title: Tired of "Terminate batch job (Y/N)?", try this
item.description: When you invoke a batch file or most applications in a command-prompt and when you wish to close the application by doing a CTRL+C, you get the annoying “Terminate batch job (Y/N)?” prompt. And in most cases, even if you type a “n”, it still kills the application. Example is the Tomcat startup. To avoid this, try this: [sourcecode language=“jscript”] YourScript.cmd < Nul [/sourcecode] This should no longer ask you with the annoying prompt “Terminate batch job (Y/N)?
